thread.title: ‘Cautionary action’ against arrear debtors!

author: news24.com
title: ‘Cautionary action’ against arrear debtors!
text:
What next the Bolsheviks Party of South Africa would like to know?
The ANC in a communiqué addressed to all Metropolitan Council, where they may lose their support basis come the 2016 local elections; have told all Metropolitan Councils ‘to act with caution’ against all those that owe the metropolitan councils for service delivery.
Billions of Rands are owed by consumers, with Johannesburg (R20.1 billion) Ekurhuleni (R14.8 billion) and Tshwane (R 10.4 billion) topping list of the most outstanding representing in excess of 350 000 consumers.
The ANC well aware of the fact that should they suspend services to all these ‘arrear consumers’ that such suspension of service would for sure cost them the vote come the elections and that is something that they can ill afford.
This is but one of the most ridiculously attempts of clinging onto straw to save the day. Yes consumers may be given the grace and not have their services suspended for now, but in the run up to the elections will use the services and just add to their arrears, and when the ANC are well back in the ‘cushions of power’, nothing will then stop them to disrupt and or suspend services for all those that are in arrears as they are then safe for another 5 year in office.
They have fooled them to once again be elected but don’t think that the window of writing off such debts would ever be, as the SALGA Act clearly states that Council’s should ensure that all outstanding debt, government or not need to be recovered in a good administrative and accountable manner.
Yes some of these debts outstanding have been outstanding for more than three years and it would be a contravention of both the Consumers Protection Act (PCA) and the Prescription Act to pursue customers with debt older than three (3) years as there can be no attempt to recover arrears older than three (3) years, and any attempt to do so will result in a R 1 million fine per account or 10% of the annual turnover of the one that is trying to pursue the collections thereof.
But at the end of the day someone and in this instance, the loyal taxpayers would be paying for the services that have been rendered as ESKOM has to be paid for bulk supply and with consumers not paying, ESKOM would disconnect the Metropolitan Councils for failing to pay their dues, so once again the taxpayer’s become the sponsors for all those ones that refuse and or cannot pay their respective bills for service delivery that they enjoy.
Another ingenious way of ‘cushioning voters’ with voters not realizing that ultimately they would have to pay, and that is a fact, as much as the fact that the ruling party has to make every possible attempt to retain the voter support and would most probably come up with more ingenious ways to retain the support base in the months leading up to the elections.
